conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric cutaway with volumetric walls, visible thickness, and exposed interior spaces.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness, readable floor plane separation, good corner geometry, and clean cutaway; minor simplification in some wall/top-face detailing.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall apartment envelope and central living/dining/kitchen zone broadly match, but several internal partitions/room definitions (notably wet-area/bathroom zoning and some right-side/central subdivision details) appear simplified or shifted vs the 2D plan; openings are not reliably mapped to the plan.

interior_elements.notes: Living/dining furniture and beds are present; kitchen is represented as simplified blocks; bathroom fixtures are largely absent, reducing confidence in room identity matching.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean, readable geometry with good visibility; materials are very uniform which reduces element distinction, but no major artifacts or UI/text contamination.

detected_errors.description: Internal layout fidelity issues: some partitions/room subdivisions (especially bathroom/wet-area configuration and portions of the right-side/central arrangement) do not clearly match the 2D plan.
Doors/windows are shown as generic openings; exact door placements/swing logic and window counts/positions cannot be confidently matched to the 2D plan.
Bathroom fixtures are missing, weakening validation of bathroom locations and room identities.
Overly uniform materials reduce clarity between structural elements and furniture/kitchen components.

summary: A valid and clean 3D cutaway conversion is achieved, but several internal partition/room-definition details and opening/fixture mappings do not faithfully follow the 2D plan.
